still worked tho...strange since enumerate composed with range should yield a tuple thus accessing the diagonal of the mask (in this case)...seems like that would have broken things (in a more general way)
ok if your fix worked grrat

        cond = cond.swapaxes(axis, 0)

                        dtype=bool)

comments.body: use a date_formatter function (like above); you don't need to handle nulls here as that is already handled in the imask (eg you will get NO nulls in the list comprehension)

        imask = (-mask).ravel()

        if date_format is None:
            date_formatter = lambda x: Timestamp(x)._repr_base
